channel.title: Papers with Code: Trending (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: GLM-130B: An Open Bilingual Pre-trained Model
item.description: We introduce GLM-130B, a bilingual (English and Chinese) pre-trained language model with 130 billion parameters.

item.title: HyperReel: High-Fidelity 6-DoF Video with Ray-Conditioned Sampling
item.description: Volumetric scene representations enable photorealistic view synthesis for static scenes and form the basis of several existing 6-DoF video techniques.

item.title: Deep Differentiable Logic Gate Networks
item.description: Recently, research has increasingly focused on developing efficient neural network architectures.

item.title: Designing BERT for Convolutional Networks: Sparse and Hierarchical Masked Modeling
item.description: This is the first use of sparse convolution for 2D masked modeling.

item.title: GNM: A General Navigation Model to Drive Any Robot
item.description: Learning provides a powerful tool for vision-based navigation, but the capabilities of learning-based policies are constrained by limited training data.

item.title: Box2Mask: Box-supervised Instance Segmentation via Level-set Evolution
item.description: In contrast to fully supervised methods using pixel-wise mask labels, box-supervised instance segmentation takes advantage of simple box annotations, which has recently attracted increasing research attention.

item.title: ConvNeXt V2: Co-designing and Scaling ConvNets with Masked Autoencoders
item.description: This co-design of self-supervised learning techniques and architectural improvement results in a new model family called ConvNeXt V2, which significantly improves the performance of pure ConvNets on various recognition benchmarks, including ImageNet classification, COCO detection, and ADE20K segmentation.

item.title: Pseudo Numerical Methods for Diffusion Models on Manifolds
item.description: Under such a perspective, we propose pseudo numerical methods for diffusion models (PNDMs).

item.title: Vectorized and performance-portable Quicksort
item.description: Recent works showed that implementations of Quicksort using vector CPU instructions can outperform the non-vectorized algorithms in widespread use.

item.title: unilm
item.description: Large-scale Self-supervised Pre-training Across Tasks, Languages, and Modalities

item.title: DeepMatcher: A Deep Transformer-based Network for Robust and Accurate Local Feature Matching
item.description: In this work, we propose DeepMatcher, a deep Transformer-based network built upon our investigation of local feature matching in detector-free methods.

item.title: Muse: Text-To-Image Generation via Masked Generative Transformers
item.description: Compared to pixel-space diffusion models, such as Imagen and DALL-E 2, Muse is significantly more efficient due to the use of discrete tokens and requiring fewer sampling iterations; compared to autoregressive models, such as Parti, Muse is more efficient due to the use of parallel decoding.

item.title: GPT Takes the Bar Exam
item.description: Nearly all jurisdictions in the United States require a professional license exam, commonly referred to as "the Bar Exam," as a precondition for law practice.

item.title: Discovering faster matrix multiplication algorithms with reinforcement learning
item.description: Particularly relevant is the case of 4 × 4 matrices in a finite field, where AlphaTensor’s algorithm improves on Strassen’s two-level algorithm for the first time, to our knowledge, since its discovery 50 years ago2.

item.title: The Forward-Forward Algorithm: Some Preliminary Investigations
item.description: The aim of this paper is to introduce a new learning procedure for neural networks and to demonstrate that it works well enough on a few small problems to be worth further investigation.

item.title: BEAT: A Large-Scale Semantic and Emotional Multi-Modal Dataset for Conversational Gestures Synthesis
item.description: Achieving realistic, vivid, and human-like synthesized conversational gestures conditioned on multi-modal data is still an unsolved problem due to the lack of available datasets, models and standard evaluation metrics.

item.title: Large Language Models as Corporate Lobbyists
item.description: We use hundreds of novel ground-truth labels of the relevance of a bill to a company to benchmark the performance of the model, which outperforms the baseline of predicting the most common outcome of irrelevance.

item.title: Attention Is All You Need
item.description: The dominant sequence transduction models are based on complex recurrent or convolutional neural networks in an encoder-decoder configuration.

item.title: Point-E: A System for Generating 3D Point Clouds from Complex Prompts
item.description: This is in stark contrast to state-of-the-art generative image models, which produce samples in a number of seconds or minutes.

item.title: NeRF-SLAM: Real-Time Dense Monocular SLAM with Neural Radiance Fields
item.description: We propose a novel geometric and photometric 3D mapping pipeline for accurate and real-time scene reconstruction from monocular images.
